Submodules

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL module

class HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.Config

Bases: object

Config class used in HartreeParticleDSL. The Config class can be used to store simulation specific data, including constants etc. Support for modifiable fields in the Config class is a work in progress.

add_element(variable_name, c_type)

Add an element to the Config type.

Parameters

  • variable_name (str) – The name of the variable type. This must be unique.

  • c_type (str) – The c_type associated with the variable type. At current this is a string but may change in future.

Raises

RepeatedNameError – If variable_name is already in the Config

reset_config()

Reset the Config class to its initial state.

class HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.Particle

Bases: object

Particle class used in HartreeParticleDSL

add_element(variable_name, c_type)

Add an element to the Particle type.

Parameters

  • variable_name (str) – The name of the variable type. This must be unique.

  • c_type (str) – The c_type associated with the variable type. At current this is a string but may change in future.

reset_particle()

Reset the particle class to its initial state.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.gen_code()

Function that generates the first section of code for the chosen kernels, particle and config.

This calls the chosen backend and generates the include code, the required header files and the kernel code

At the moment this is just output to stdout.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.gen_invoke(kernel_name, current_indent, indent)

Generates the code used to invoke a specific kernel. This is accessed by visitors in the main function to create code for a specific invoke call.

At current this is output to stdout.

Parameters

  • kernel_name (str) – The name of the kernel to create invoke code for.

  • current_indent (int) – The current indentation level in the code.

  • indent (int) – The amount to indent for each line of code.

Returns

The string to invoke this kernel

Rval

str

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.initialise(particle_count=0, filename='')

Function that returns the initialisation code call for the chosen IO module and backend combination

Returns

The initialisation call for the chosen configuration.

Return type

str

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.print_main(function)

Generates the main function code for the specified function and backend.

This currently outputs for stdout.

Parameters

function (:py:class:`) – The main function to be generated by the backend.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.println(string, *args)

Generates the code to perform a println call. This is accessed by visitors in the main function to create code for a specific println call.

Work in progress.

Parameters

  • string (str) – The base string to use in a println call.

  • args ([str]+) – Any number of strings used for formatted string generation

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.register_kernel(kernel_name, kernel)

Function to register a kernel used in HartreeParticleDSL. This is usually accessed directly by the wrapper function and not needed for user-level code.

Parameters

  • kernel_name (str) – The name of the kernel.

  • kernel (:py:class:`HartreeParticleDSL.kernel_types.kernels.kernel) – The Kernel object corresponding to the kernel_name.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.set_backend(backend)

Function that sets the backend used by HartreeParticleDSL

Parameters

backend (HartreeParticleDSL.backends.base_backend.Backend) – The backend to use for this application.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.set_config_type(config)

Function to set the Config type used by HartreeParticleDSL

Parameters

part (HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.Config) – The Config to use for this application.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.set_io_modules(input_mod, output_mod)

Function to set the Input and Output modules used by HartreeParticleDSL. Both the input and output modules can be the same module, but may also be different modules.

Parameters

  • input_module (HartreeParticleDSL.IO_Module.base_IO_module.IO_module) – the IO module to use for input for this application.

  • output_module – the IO module to use for output for this application.

HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.set_particle_type(part)

Function to set the Particle type used by HartreeParticleDSL

Parameters

part (HartreeParticleDSL.HartreeParticleDSL.Particle) – The Particle to use for this application.
